title: Den11
author: Den11
content: Guys, tell me if there is an exchange that is as similar as txbit.io visually and functionally. If anyone knows, please tell me!

comments.author: dimonstration
comments.body: Quote from: Den11 on September 17, 2023, 12:56:32 PMGuys, tell me if there is an exchange that is as similar as txbit.io visually and functionally. If anyone knows, please tell me!You should move this on service discussion https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=85.0 since this is all about the feature of a service.Txbet.io which is the exchange you are using as reference is already shutdown so most of us here doesn’t have any idea how this exchange looks like. It will be easier if you will describe what kind of feature you are looking for on an exchange so that we can suggest you the one that fit to your description.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Visually speaking, I don't think you'll have a hard time adapting to most spot exchanges.Funtionality wise, you'd have to be more specific. But my general answer is, it's a lot more closer to lesser known exchanges with no mandatory KYC e.g. MEXC. I hope you're not aiming for the 0% trading fee subscription plan feature though as you may have a hard time finding that one.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: dimonstration on September 17, 2023, 01:04:18 PMTxbet.io which is the exchange you are using as reference is already shutdown so most of us here doesn’t have any idea how this exchange looks like. It will be easier if you will describe what kind of feature you are looking for on an exchange so that we can suggest you the one that fit to your description.I haven't seen anything spectacular in the appearance of this exchange, at least judging by what can be seen in the archive, and I honestly don't believe that just using this exchange was an amazing experience. https://web.archive.org/web/20230530195659/https://txbit.io/What is more worrying is that people continue to use anonymous and dubious services under the pretext of exchange. Shouldn't we be more careful to whom we entrust money, even for a short time just for one trade?

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Quote from: Den11 on September 17, 2023, 12:56:32 PMGuys, tell me if there is an exchange that is as similar as txbit.io visually and functionally. If anyone knows, please tell me!So what feature that you like most about this exchange so that we can give you a recommendation, I didn't use an unknown exchange that might not have enough reputation to entrust our fund.  There's a lot of exchange that we can choose which is trusted enough, if you're willing to undergo KYC procedures go for CEXs and if you want to protect your privacy we have DEXs.You can choose them here.[BIG LIST] Buy/Sell Crypto (OTC, P2P, DEXs, CEXs, NO-KYC, ATMs, etc.).

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: I did not find any other business offers on this exchange other than trading.Their visual appearance is uniquely designed, I have never found anything like it. That seems to be the focus of their business, usually they own the copyright to their designs which I think is impossible to find anywhere else unless they have some kind of cloud service for partners.

comments.author: Den11
comments.body: Quote from: sheenshane on September 18, 2023, 11:02:45 PMQuote from: Den11 on September 17, 2023, 12:56:32 PMGuys, tell me if there is an exchange that is as similar as txbit.io visually and functionally. If anyone knows, please tell me!So what feature that you like most about this exchange so that we can give you a recommendation, I didn't use an unknown exchange that might not have enough reputation to entrust our fund.  There's a lot of exchange that we can choose which is trusted enough, if you're willing to undergo KYC procedures go for CEXs and if you want to protect your privacy we have DEXs.You can choose them here.[BIG LIST] Buy/Sell Crypto (OTC, P2P, DEXs, CEXs, NO-KYC, ATMs, etc.).Thanks for the list

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: By looking at this link https://web.archive.org/web/20230530195659/https://txbit.io/ almost all the features in it are available and you can search this list https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5461920.0 that are not strict about identity verification.Visa, Mastercard and advcash you can use bestchange.com It will give you a list of platforms that accept these payments and convert them to Bitcoin, and then you can use the list above to trade or exchange between cryptocurrencies.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: examplens on September 18, 2023, 06:56:35 PMI haven't seen anything spectacular in the appearance of this exchange, at least judging by what can be seen in the archive, and I honestly don't believe that just using this exchange was an amazing experience. https://web.archive.org/web/20230530195659/https://txbit.io/What is more worrying is that people continue to use anonymous and dubious services under the pretext of exchange. Shouldn't we be more careful to whom we entrust money, even for a short time just for one trade?I agree with you. I just checked on the archived version and nothing special visual wise... maybe functional wise, which OP did not mention. Maybe he should just move on. I also experience the difficulty of using a new exchange after moving on from an old one, but I would eventually get used to it.How many still remember the old days of Bittrex and Etherdelta?

comments.author: milewilda
comments.body: Quote from: logfiles on September 19, 2023, 11:49:20 PMQuote from: examplens on September 18, 2023, 06:56:35 PMI haven't seen anything spectacular in the appearance of this exchange, at least judging by what can be seen in the archive, and I honestly don't believe that just using this exchange was an amazing experience. https://web.archive.org/web/20230530195659/https://txbit.io/What is more worrying is that people continue to use anonymous and dubious services under the pretext of exchange. Shouldn't we be more careful to whom we entrust money, even for a short time just for one trade?I agree with you. I just checked on the archived version and nothing special visual wise... maybe functional wise, which OP did not mention. Maybe he should just move on. I also experience the difficulty of using a new exchange after moving on from an old one, but I would eventually get used to it.How many still remember the old days of Bittrex and Etherdelta?  Poloniex, Etherdelta for DEX and then Bittrex which those exchangers are ones dominated those early years until they had been replaced by Binance and some known platforms like OKX or KUcoin .. lots to mention.Link given above for the said list which it is really that ideal that you should really be simply sticking into those reputable exchange platforms.Been using up before with Kucoin because of that non mandatory but they had changed up that thing and goes along with the standard and have that mandatory KYc which is shit. https://www.coindesk.com/business/2023/06/28/crypto-exchange-kucoin-to-introduce-mandatory-id-checks-next-month/Txbit.io? I havent been able to hear up but basing on the long list of current number of exchangers then its not shocking that lots of names cant really be memorized one by one. Its better to make yourself stick into thosehigh ranking or reputable or known ones rather than on going into those non popular because majority of them arent really that could be trusted.Hence, top platforms does have it all.
